    • Constructor Detail

      • Mysql

        public Mysql()
        Initializes a new Mysql database, but doesn't configure or connect

      • Mysql

        public Mysql(java.lang.String host,
     java.lang.String username,
     java.lang.String password)
        Initializes, configures and connects to a new Mysql database
        Parameters:
        host - the hostname of the mysql server, fx. "localhost" or "example.com"
        username - the username of the mysql server.
        password - the password of the mysql server. Use an empty string for no password.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String host,
           java.lang.String username,
           java.lang.String password)
        Connects / reconnects to a database, gets called automatic in constructor if information is passed
        Parameters:
        host - the hostname of the mysql server, fx. "localhost" or "example.com"
        username - the username of the mysql server.
        password - the password of the mysql server. Use an empty string for no password.

      • query

        public java.sql.ResultSet query(java.lang.String query)
        Executes a query, to the mysql server
        Parameters:
        query - the query to execute fx. "SELECT * FROM database.table", where database is the name of the database, and table is the name of the table
        Returns:
        the selected rows, if any else returning NULL

      • close

        public void close()
        Frees up the ram. Call it when you're done using the database.
